snippet: An Egyptian human rights lawyer was convicted Tuesday of smuggling drugs into the kingdom and sentenced to five years in prison and 300 lashes, Egypt’s state news agency reported.
abstract: Egyptian human rights lawyer Ahmed el-Gezawi is convicted of smuggling drugs into Saudi Arabia and sentenced to five years in prison and 300 lashes; case draws outcry in Egypt, where Gezawi's relatives and human rights groups claim he was detained for allegedly insulting the kingdom’s monarch.
lead_paragraph: An Egyptian human rights lawyer was convicted Tuesday of smuggling drugs into the kingdom and sentenced to five years in prison and 300 lashes, Egypt’s state news agency reported.

headline.seo: Saudi Arabia: Egyptian Rights Lawyer Is Convicted on Smuggling Charges
